title: Where is user.config in mR 1.78.2 NB 3228?
author: Cool34000
body_snippet:
Hi,

I'm testing mRemoteNG 1.78.2 NB 3228 x64
I can't find the configuration file for the options of mRemoteNG (previously stored in user.config)
I've searched in:
- Portable version folder
- %AppData%\mRemoteNG Connection Manager
- %LocalAppData%\mRemoteNG Connection Manager (only have a log file)

I've even checked in th registry and found nothing.


Thanks

comments.snippet: As of now mRemoteNG 1.77.3+ (including 1.78 NB) does not save any configuration files as the core settings architecture is being rewritten.
comments.author: simonai1254

comments.snippet:
OK... But the configuration must be stored somewhere?
I also check the registry and I can't found anything!
So how can I delete some settings that were accidentally configured?

For example, I enabled MSSQL and the configuration is not working.
I have a big warning when mR starts that says that it's not working and I don't have access to mRemote anymore.
I need to reset the settings so MSSQL is disabled.

Can't do that?
comments.author: Cool34000

comments.snippet: hello, i will add reset option to next NB, technicaly settings are in file but its a db so its not something you could edit and its encrypted :)
comments.author: Kvarkas

comments.snippet:
OK!
Could you please tell me in which DB file it's stored so I can delete it to get my access back?

comments.snippet:
Fork-side candidate fix is now ready:
- PR: https://github.com/mRemoteNG/mRemoteNG/pull/3120
- scope:
  - log exact effective user settings file path at startup (`User settings file: ...`)
  - expose resolved path in `SettingsFileInfo`
  - update troubleshooting docs for installed vs portable settings locations

Why this helps:
- issue `#2987` reports users cannot reliably locate/reset settings after configuration failures
- installed build path can vary by company metadata + hash, so fixed/stat...
